page.title: 19A PUPIL'S DAY IN TOFTWOOD
page.content: I got changed and watched television until 5.15p.m. when I did the washing-up. At 5.30 I ate dinner in the lounge with my Mum and sister, my Dad is often late as he works for a washing machine company in Norwich. We had sausages, beans and chips. At 6.00 p.m. I went upstairs to listen to my radio while my suster did the washing-up. At 6.45 p.m I went out to hand-bell ringing with my friend. I did not play until 7.30p.m. as they were practising a tune which I was not needed for, but by 8.00p.m we were on our way home. I watched television until 9.00 p.m. when I made coffee and got ready for bed, I stayed watching television until 10.00 p.m. and by 10.15 p.m. I was in bed.
